actualWork.description: Indicates the actual time entered against the task.
actualWork.name: actualWork

company.externalId.description: Indicates the customer and project that this task belongs to.All project tasks must be created in the context of a project and cannot be moved from one project to another.
company.externalId.name: company.externalId

company.internalId.description: Indicates the customer and project that this task belongs to.All project tasks must be created in the context of a project and cannot be moved from one project to another.
company.internalId.name: company.internalId

company.name.description: Indicates the customer and project that this task belongs to.All project tasks must be created in the context of a project and cannot be moved from one project to another.
company.name.name: company.name

constraintType.value.description: Specifies how to determine the start and end dates for a task.As Soon As Possible: NetSuite calculates the earliest possible start date for a task based on existing predecessors and sets the end date based on the available work time in the assigned resource's work calendar.Fixed Date: The task starts on the date you specify. Predecessor relationships are ignored. The task end date is based on the estimated work for the task and the assigned resource's available work time.
constraintType.value.name: constraintType.value

contact.externalId.description: Select a contact for this task.
contact.externalId.name: contact.externalId

contact.internalId.description: Select a contact for this task.
contact.internalId.name: contact.internalId

contact.name.description: Select a contact for this task.
contact.name.name: contact.name

customForm.externalId.description: Select the form you want to use to enter this record.Select Standard Project Task Form to continue using this form, select a custom project task form you have already created, or select New to create a custom project task form.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: Select the form you want to use to enter this record.Select Standard Project Task Form to continue using this form, select a custom project task form you have already created, or select New to create a custom project task form.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: Select the form you want to use to enter this record.Select Standard Project Task Form to continue using this form, select a custom project task form you have already created, or select New to create a custom project task form.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

endDate.description: Indicates the estimated date when work for this task will be completed.NetSuite derives this date from the estimated work and other task dependencies. This date can change over the life of the project if the amount of work, resources assigned, or task dependencies change.When the task status is Completed, the end date is the date of the last time entry entered against the task.
endDate.name: endDate

endDateBaseline.description: The date in the End Date field when the baseline was set.
endDateBaseline.name: endDateBaseline

estimatedWork.description: Estimated Work for a project task is the total of all completed and planned work for this task.NetSuite calculates this field by summing the estimated work entered for the resources. If you enter a value in this field, then NetSuite distributes the amount equally to all resources assigned to this task.If you also use Resource Allocations and the Allow Allocated Resources to Enter Time to All Tasks preference is enabled for this project, the estimated work field is updated to add any time tracked against tasks by allocated resources.When task status is marked Completed, this number is set to equal Actual Work.
estimatedWork.name: estimatedWork

estimatedWorkBaseline.description: The value in the Estimated Work field when the baseline was set.
estimatedWorkBaseline.name: estimatedWorkBaseline

finishByDate.description: Select the date this task must be finished by.This constraint takes precedence over task relationships and start dates are adjusted according to the fixed end date of a task with a Finish No Later Than constraint.
finishByDate.name: finishByDate

message.description: Enter any comments for the task.
message.name: message

nonBillableTask.description: Check this box to designate this task as non-billable.When time is entered against this task, it is automatically marked as non-billable and cannot be changed to billable.
nonBillableTask.name: nonBillableTask

order.externalId.description: To place the new task in the proper order in the schedule, select the task that follows it.
order.externalId.name: order.externalId

order.internalId.description: To place the new task in the proper order in the schedule, select the task that follows it.
order.internalId.name: order.internalId

order.name.description: To place the new task in the proper order in the schedule, select the task that follows it.
order.name.name: order.name

owner.externalId.description: The name of the employee who created this task.
owner.externalId.name: owner.externalId

owner.internalId.description: The name of the employee who created this task.
owner.internalId.name: owner.internalId

owner.name.description: The name of the employee who created this task.
owner.name.name: owner.name

parent.externalId.description: Select a parent task if the task you are creating is part of a group of tasks. The parent task summarizes data for all of its subordinate tasks. You cannot assign resources to a parent task.
parent.externalId.name: parent.externalId

parent.internalId.description: Select a parent task if the task you are creating is part of a group of tasks. The parent task summarizes data for all of its subordinate tasks. You cannot assign resources to a parent task.
parent.internalId.name: parent.internalId

parent.name.description: Select a parent task if the task you are creating is part of a group of tasks. The parent task summarizes data for all of its subordinate tasks. You cannot assign resources to a parent task.
parent.name.name: parent.name

percentTimeComplete.description: Shows the percent of planned project task time that has been completed.Percent Complete is calculated as follows:[Actual Work / Estimated Work]Percent Complete is 100% when the task status is Completed and Estimated Work is set to Actual Work.
percentTimeComplete.name: percentTimeComplete

priority.externalId.description: Indicate how important the task is. Tasks with higher priorities should be worked on before tasks with lower priorities.  Task priority does not affect the project schedule.
priority.externalId.name: priority.externalId

priority.internalId.description: Indicate how important the task is. Tasks with higher priorities should be worked on before tasks with lower priorities.  Task priority does not affect the project schedule.
priority.internalId.name: priority.internalId

priority.name.description: Indicate how important the task is. Tasks with higher priorities should be worked on before tasks with lower priorities.  Task priority does not affect the project schedule.
priority.name.name: priority.name

remainingWork.description: Remaining Work is calculated as:[Estimated Work - Actual Work]Before work starts on a task, Remainng Work is the same as Estimated Work.When a task is marked Completed, Estimated Work is set to equal Actual Work and Remaining Work is 0.
remainingWork.name: remainingWork

startDate.description: Indicates the estimated date to begin work on the task.If the task constraint is Fixed Date, enter the date to begin work on the task.If the constraint is As Soon As Possible, NetSuite determines the Start Date based on the schedule.
startDate.name: startDate

startDateBaseline.description: The date in the State Date field when the baseline was set.
startDateBaseline.name: startDateBaseline

status.value.description: The status for a task can be:Completed - task has been finishedIn Progress - task is being worked onNot Started - task has not been startedYou must have permission to edit a task record to change the status.
status.value.name: status.value

title.description: Enter a name for the project task.
title.name: title

type.value.description: Indicate how important the task is. Tasks with higher priorities should be worked on before tasks with lower priorities.  Task priority does not affect the project schedule.
type.value.name: type.value
